Detailed Description

Author:
Mark Hoemmen <mhoemmen@cs.berkeley.edu>
Date:
20 Jul 2008
Untuned implementation of sparse matrix-matrix multiplication.

Function Documentation

int csr_matmatmult_double_complex ( int **  pCptr,
int **  pCind,
double_Complex **  pCval,
int *  pCnnz,
double_Complex  alpha,
int *  Aptr,
int *  Aind,
double_Complex *  Aval,
int *  Bptr,
int *  Bind,
double_Complex *  Bval,
const int  m,
const int  p,
const int  n 
)

Computes C := alpha * A * B, in which A, B and C are CSR format sparse matrices storing double precision complex values. A is dimension m x p and B is dimension p x n.

Parameters:
pCptr [OUT] pointer to the ptr array in the CSR structure of C
pCind [OUT] pointer to the ind array in the CSR structure of C
pCval [OUT] pointer to the val array in the CSR structure of C
pCnnz [OUT] pointer to the number of (structural) nonzeros in C
alpha [IN] scalar multiplier
Aptr [IN] ptr array in the CSR structure of A
Aind [IN] ind array in the CSR structure of A
Aval [IN] val array in the CSR structure of A
Bptr [IN] ptr array in the CSR structure of B
Bind [IN] ind array in the CSR structure of B
Bval [IN] val array in the CSR structure of B
m [IN] number of rows in A and C
p [IN] number of columns in A, and number of rows in B
n [IN] number of columns in B, and number of columns in C
Returns:
Error code (zero if no error)

double *  Bval,
const int  m,
const int  p,
const int  n 
)

Computes C := alpha * A * B, in which A, B and C are CSR format sparse matrices storing double precision real values. A is dimension m x p and B is dimension p x n.

Parameters:
pCptr [OUT] pointer to the ptr array in the CSR structure of C
pCind [OUT] pointer to the ind array in the CSR structure of C
pCval [OUT] pointer to the val array in the CSR structure of C
pCnnz [OUT] pointer to the number of (structural) nonzeros in C
alpha [IN] scalar multiplier
Aptr [IN] ptr array in the CSR structure of A
Aind [IN] ind array in the CSR structure of A
Aval [IN] val array in the CSR structure of A
Bptr [IN] ptr array in the CSR structure of B
Bind [IN] ind array in the CSR structure of B
Bval [IN] val array in the CSR structure of B
m [IN] number of rows in A and C
p [IN] number of columns in A, and number of rows in B
n [IN] number of columns in B, and number of columns in C
Returns:
Error code (zero if no error)

int csr_matmatmult_pattern ( int **  pCptr,
int **  pCind,
int *  pCnnz,
int *  Aptr,
int *  Aind,
int *  Bptr,
int *  Bind,
const int  m,
const int  p,
const int  n 
)

Computes C := A * B, in which A, B and C are CSR format sparse matrices storing patterns (no nonzero values, just indices). A is dimension m x p and B is dimension p x n.

Parameters:
pCptr [OUT] pointer to the ptr array in the CSR structure of C
pCind [OUT] pointer to the ind array in the CSR structure of C
pCnnz [OUT] pointer to the number of (structural) nonzeros in C
Aptr [IN] ptr array in the CSR structure of A
Aind [IN] ind array in the CSR structure of A
Bptr [IN] ptr array in the CSR structure of B
Bind [IN] ind array in the CSR structure of B
m [IN] number of rows in A and C
p [IN] number of columns in A, and number of rows in B
n [IN] number of columns in B, and number of columns in C
Returns:
Error code (zero if no error)
